com.igzcode.java.gae.serialization
Class DataTableList

java.lang.Object
  com.igzcode.java.gae.serialization.DataTableList

public class DataTableList
extends Object

Serialize data as DataTableList format.

See Also:
http://code.google.com/p/datatablelist/, http://js-dtl.appspot.com/

                   int p_int)
Add a int variable. 
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddVar("name", 10);
 // Result: {"name":10}

AddTable

public void AddTable(Enum[] p_values)
Add a enum table. The table name will be the enum name to upper case. The table columns will be ["Label", "Value"]. The label values are translated automatically. A quick example: 
 Enum Gender { MALE, FEMALE }
 
 // Locale=es_ES
 // GENDER.MALE=Hombre
 // GENDER.FEMALE=Mujer
 
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList("es_ES");
 dtl.AddTable(Gender.values());
 // Result: { "cols":{"MYENUM": ["Label", "Value"]}, "MYENUM":[["Hombre", 0],["Mujer", 1]] }

Parameters:
p_values - Use the static method Enum.values()

AddTable

public <T> void AddTable(String p_tableName,
                         T p_dto,
                         Class<T> p_dataClass)
Create a new table with a DTO values. A quick example: 
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddTable("Book", bookDto, BookDto.class);
 // Result: { "cols":{"Book": ["BookId", "Title"]}, "Book":[[578, "Example title"]] }

Parameters:
p_tableName - Table name
p_dto - A entity instance
p_dataClass - Entity class

AddTable

public <T> void AddTable(String p_tableName,
                         Iterable<T> p_dtos,
                         Class<T> p_dataClass)
Create a new table with a list/collection of DTOs. A quick example: 
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddTable("Book", bookList, BookDto.class);
 // Result: { "cols":{"Book": ["BookId", "Title"]}, "Book":[[578, "Example title"],[579, "Example title 2"]] }

Parameters:
p_tableName - Table name
p_dtos - A entity list
p_dataClass - Entity class

AddTable

public <T> void AddTable(String p_tableName,
                         T[] p_dtos,
                         Class<T> p_dataClass)
Create a new table with a primitive array of DTOs. A quick example: 
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddTable("Book", bookArray, BookDto.class);
 // Result: { "cols":{"Book": ["BookId", "Title"]}, "Book":[[578, "Example title"],[579, "Example title 2"]] }

Parameters:
p_tableName - Table name
p_dtos - A entity list
p_dataClass - Entity class

AddTable

public <T> void AddTable(String p_tableName,
                         T p_dto,
                         String[] p_fields,
                         Class<?> p_dataClass)
Create a new table with a DTO values of specified fields. A quick example: 
 String[] fields = new String[] {"_Title"};
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddTable("Book", book, fields, BookDto.class);
 // Result: { "cols":{"Book": ["Title"]}, "Book":[["Example title"]] }

Parameters:
p_tableName - Table name
p_dto - A entity list
p_fields - Fields to be serialized
p_dataClass - Entity class

AddTable

public <T> void AddTable(String p_tableName,
                         Iterable<T> p_dtos,
                         String[] p_fields,
                         Class<?> p_dataClass)
Create a new table with a list/collection of DTOs for the specified fields. A quick example: 
 String[] fields = new String[] {"_Title"};
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddTable("Book", bookList, fields, BookDto.class);
 // Result: { "cols":{"Book": ["Title"]}, "Book":[["Example title"],["Example title 2"]] }

Parameters:
p_tableName - Table name
p_dto - A entity list
p_fields - Fields to be serialized
p_dataClass - Entity class

AddTable

public <T> void AddTable(String p_tableName,
                         T[] p_dtos,
                         String[] p_fields,
                         Class<?> p_dataClass)
Create a new table with a primitive array of DTOs for the specified fields. A quick example: 
 String[] fields = new String[] {"_Title"};
 DataTableList dtl = new DataTableList();
 dtl.AddTable("Book", bookArray, fields, BookDto.class);
 // Result: { "cols":{"Book": ["Title"]}, "Book":[["Example title"],["Example title 2"]] }

Parameters:
p_tableName - Table name
p_dto - A entity list
p_fields - Fields to be serialized
p_dataClass - Entity class

ToString

Serialize added tables and variables into a String.

Returns:
A valid JSON with the added data
